member.name: T:System.Web.Http.QueryableAttribute
member.summary: This class defines an attribute that can be applied to an action to enable querying using the OData query syntax. To avoid processing unexpected or malicious queries, use the validation settings on to validate incoming queries. For more information, visit http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=279712.

member.name: M:System.Web.Http.QueryableAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Enables a controller action to support OData query parameters.

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.QueryableAttribute.AllowedArithmeticOperators
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that represents a list of allowed arithmetic operators including 'add', 'sub', 'mul', 'div', 'mod'.
member.returns: Returns .

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.QueryableAttribute.AllowedFunctions
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that represents a list of allowed functions used in the $filter query. The allowed functions include the following: String related: substringof, endswith, startswith, length, indexof, substring, tolower, toupper, trim, concat e.g. ~/Customers?$filter=length(CompanyName) eq 19 DateTime related: year, years, month, months, day, days, hour, hours, minute, minutes, second, seconds e.g. ~/Employees?$filter=year(BirthDate) eq 1971 Math related: round, floor, ceiling Type related:isof, cast, Collection related: any, all
member.returns: Returns .

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.QueryableAttribute.AllowedLogicalOperators
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that represents a list of allowed logical Operators such as 'eq', 'ne', 'gt', 'ge', 'lt', 'le', 'and', 'or', 'not'.
member.returns: Returns .

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.QueryableAttribute.AllowedOrderByProperties
member.summary: Gets or sets a string with comma-separated list of property names. The queriable result can only be ordered by those properties defined in this list. Note, by default this string is null, which means it can be ordered by any property. For example, setting this value to null or empty string means that we allow ordering the queriable result by any properties. Setting this value to "Name" means we only allow queriable result to be ordered by Name property.
member.returns: Returns .

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.QueryableAttribute.AllowedQueryOptions
member.summary: Gets or sets the query parameters that are allowed in queries. The default is all query options, including $filter, $skip, $top, $orderby, $expand, $select, $inlineCount, $format and $skiptoken.
member.returns: Returns .

member.name: M:System.Web.Http.QueryableAttribute.ApplyQuery(System.Linq.IQueryable,System.Web.Http.OData.Query.ODataQueryOptions)
member.summary: Applies the query to the given IQueryable based on incoming query from uri and query settings.
member.returns: Returns .
member.param: The original queriable instance from the response message.
The instance constructed based on the incoming request.

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.QueryableAttribute.EnableConstantParameterization
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether constants should be parameterized. Parameterizing constants would result in better performance with Entity framework.
member.returns: The default value is true .

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.QueryableAttribute.EnsureStableOrdering
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether query composition should alter the original query when necessary to ensure a stable sort order.
member.returns: A true value indicates the original query should be modified when necessary to guarantee a stable sort order. A false value indicates the sort order can be considered stable without modifying the query. Query providers that ensure a stable sort order should set this value to false . The default value is true .

member.name: M:System.Web.Http.QueryableAttribute.OnActionExecuted(System.Web.Http.Filters.HttpActionExecutedContext)
member.summary: Performs the query composition after action is executed. It first tries to retrieve the IQueryable from the returning response message. It then validates the query from uri based on the validation settings on QueryableAttribute. It finally applies the query appropriately, and reset it back on the response message.

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.OData.Query.ODataValidationSettings.AllowedFunctions
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of allowed functions used in the $filter query. The allowed functions include the following: String related: substringof, endswith, startswith, length, indexof, substring, tolower, toupper, trim, concat e.g. ~/Customers?$filter=length(CompanyName) eq 19 DateTime related: year, years, month, months, day, days, hour, hours, minute, minutes, second, seconds e.g. ~/Employees?$filter=year(BirthDate) eq 1971 Math related: round, floor, ceiling Type related:isof, cast, Collection related: any, all

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.OData.Query.ODataValidationSettings.AllowedLogicalOperators
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of allowed logical operators such as 'eq', 'ne', 'gt', 'ge', 'lt', 'le', 'and', 'or', 'not'.

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.OData.Query.ODataValidationSettings.AllowedOrderByProperties
member.summary: Gets a list of properties one can order by the result with. Note, by default this list is empty, it means it can be ordered by any property. For example, having an empty collection means the client can order the queriable result by any properties. Adding "Name" to this list means that it only allows queriable result to be ordered by the Name property.
